Bee Swarm Simulator (BSS) is a multiplayer idle video game released on the game platform Roblox in March 2018. It gained widespread attention for its approach to bee swarms, and how they make money in their hives, from collecting pollen from different fields, to buy items. The game's concurrent user (CCU) records, rounds up to about over 100 thousand players, typically during its "Beesmas" events. The game is owned by its original developer and Bee Swarm Simulator Club, a team owned by Piercen "Onett" Harbut. Players collect pollen with tools and your bees. As of May 2021, Bee Swarm Simulator has over 3.2 billion visits.
History
The game participated in various Roblox events throughout 2024, alongside a 2020 Egg Hunt event.
Macroing
The phrase "macroing" refers to the practice of using automated programs, often known as "bots" or "macros," to carry out operations in a game, frequently to automate repetitive activities. Onett has verified that players are permitted to use programs, even though doing so is generally discouraged. Additionally, Bee Swarm players have been utilizing them for years.
Players
The highest number of concurrent players Bee Swarm Simulator has achieved is around 200 thousand, at once. Due to the presence of microtransactions in the game and the target demographic typically being young children, there have been instances of children spending large amounts of money on Bee Swarm Simulator.
Whenever there is a Beesmas update to the game, the number of players playing may even triple.
